name: Quick Check: Discriminant Trick
explanation: Before solving a quadratic, check the discriminant (b² - 4ac) to quickly determine the nature of solutions: If positive, two real solutions; if zero, one solution; if negative, two complex solutions. This saves time by telling you what to expect before calculating. Also, if it's a perfect square, the solutions will be rational.

examples.problem: Quick check: How many real solutions does x² - 5x + 6 = 0 have?
steps: Since Δ > 0, there are two real solutions
Since Δ = 1 (perfect square), solutions are rational
Since Δ < 0, there are two complex (non-real) solutions
